channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What to expect from Trump's Davos speech. And, the DOJ subpoenas Minnesota officials
item.description: President Trump is expected to address affordability at the World Economic Forum today. And, Minnesota officials react after the Justice Department subpoenas them.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is expected to address affordability at the World Economic Forum today. And, Minnesota officials react after the Justice Department subpoenas them.

(Image credit: Ludovic Marin)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Blinken and British counterpart signal trans-Atlantic unity with visit to Ukraine
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken and his British counterpart, David Lammy, are raising alarms about Iranian ballistic missiles in Russia that threaten Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: Secretary of State Antony Blinken and his British counterpart, David Lammy, are raising alarms about Iranian ballistic missiles in Russia that threaten Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: How North Carolina erased medical debt for 2.5 million people
item.description: The state partnered with a nonprofit to wipe out the debts. It also has a plan in place to prevent medical debt for people in specific income brackets.
item.content:encoded:
The state partnered with a nonprofit to wipe out the debts. It also has a plan in place to prevent medical debt for people in specific income brackets.

(Image credit: Gary D. Robertson)
item.dc:creator: Alex Olgin

item.title: Trump administration claims offshore wind poses a threat. But it won't say how.
item.description: The Interior Department said pausing construction of offshore wind farms would allow the government agencies to work with project developers to mitigate potential risks. But wind companies say the administration isn't sharing information about newly-discovered threats.
item.content:encoded:
The Interior Department said pausing construction of offshore wind farms would allow the government agencies to work with project developers to mitigate potential risks. But wind companies say the administration isn't sharing information about newly-discovered threats.

(Image credit: Michael Dwyer/AP)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: How ICE grew to be the highest-funded U.S. law enforcement agency
item.description: ICE's budget hovered around $10 billion for years. But President Trump and the Republican-controlled Congress are taking the agency's funding to unprecedented levels.
item.content:encoded:
ICE's budget hovered around $10 billion for years. But President Trump and the Republican-controlled Congress are taking the agency's funding to unprecedented levels.

(Image credit: Erin Hooley)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: 1 year into Trump's second term, a consumer watchdog agency is 'hanging by a thread'
item.description: The Trump administration has ordered work stoppages and layoffs and has tried cutting off funding to effectively dismantle the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration has ordered work stoppages and layoffs and has tried cutting off funding to effectively dismantle the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Stephan Bisaha

item.title: How the word 'cravat' came from the battlefields of 17th century Europe
item.description: In this installment of NPR's "Word of the Week" series we trace the origins of the "cravat" (borrowed from the French "cravate") back to the battlefields of 17th century Europe.
item.content:encoded:
In this installment of NPR's "Word of the Week" series we trace the origins of the "cravat" (borrowed from the French "cravate") back to the battlefields of 17th century Europe.

(Image credit: Hrvoje Polan)
item.dc:creator: Kristina Kukolja

item.title: It's showdown time for the Fed's independence at the Supreme Court
item.description: At issue are President Trump's efforts to break with 112 years of law and precedent by firing Lisa Cook, a member of the Federal Reserve's governing board.
item.content:encoded:
At issue are President Trump's efforts to break with 112 years of law and precedent by firing Lisa Cook, a member of the Federal Reserve's governing board.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Trump heads to Davos after upending European relations over Greenland
item.description: The U.S. president is set to meet with an array of leaders to discuss Greenland. Trump's push to acquire Greenland has turned to antagonism toward allies in recent days.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. president is set to meet with an array of leaders to discuss Greenland. Trump's push to acquire Greenland has turned to antagonism toward allies in recent days.

(Image credit: Fabrice Coffrini)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump to address World Economic Forum, DOJ subpoenas Minnesota officials in obstruction probe, SCOTUS to hear case that could give presidents unprecedented control over the Fed.
item.content:encoded: Trump to address World Economic Forum, DOJ subpoenas Minnesota officials in obstruction probe, SCOTUS to hear case that could give presidents unprecedented control over the Fed.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez
